title: Mathematics: Solving Quadratic Equations
subject: Mathematics
description: Step-by-step guide to solving quadratic equations using factorization, completing the square, and quadratic formula. Includes Nigerian business examples like profit maximization calculations.
interactive_elements: Pause for practice problems, embedded calculator
nigerian_context: Examples from Nigerian retail businesses calculating optimal pricing

title: Physics: Newton's Laws in Action
subject: Physics
description: Real-world demonstrations of Newton's three laws using everyday objects and Nigerian contexts like vehicle motion in Lagos traffic.
learning_objectives: Identify law applications in daily life
nigerian_context: Traffic flow analysis in major Nigerian cities

title: Chemistry: Acid-Base Reactions
subject: Chemistry
description: Laboratory demonstration of acid-base reactions, including titration procedures and indicator usage. Features Nigerian examples like traditional soap making processes.
interactive_elements: Virtual lab simulation overlay, reaction animations
nigerian_context: Traditional black soap production using palm oil and plant ashes

title: Biology: Cell Division Process
subject: Biology
description: 3D animation showing mitosis and meiosis processes, with comparisons between plant and animal cells. Includes Nigerian examples like cell division in cassava plants.
nigerian_context: Cell division in economically important Nigerian crops

title: Economics: Nigerian Oil Economy Explained
subject: Economics
presenter: Dr. Samuel Adebayo (Nigerian Institute of Social and Economic Research)
description: Analysis of Nigeria's oil-dependent economy, including production statistics, revenue distribution, and diversification challenges. Features interactive charts and graphs.
interactive_elements: Interactive charts, timeline slider, data filters
nigerian_context: Direct analysis of Nigeria's primary economic driver

title: English: Effective Communication Skills
subject: English Language
description: Practical guide to communication skills including public speaking, active listening, and written expression. Features role-playing scenarios in Nigerian cultural contexts.
nigerian_context: Communication in diverse Nigerian settings like market negotiations and family meetings

title: Geography: Nigerian Climate Zones
subject: Geography
description: Exploration of Nigeria's four major climate zones: mangrove swamps, rainforest, savanna, and Sahel. Includes causes of climate change impacts and adaptation strategies.
interactive_elements: Zone comparison tool, climate data graphs
nigerian_context: Direct focus on Nigerian geographical diversity and climate challenges

title: History: Nigeria's Independence Journey
subject: History
presenter: Prof. Grace Nwosu (University of Port Harcourt)
description: Chronological account of Nigeria's path to independence, from colonial rule through nationalist movements to the 1960 independence. Includes perspectives from different regions.
nigerian_context: Nigeria's independence story and its regional diversity
